author: DistroTube
description:
The 'cd' shell command is used to "change directory."  It is the way you navigate around the Linux file system.

- Go to a specific directory:
  cd /path/to/directory

- Use any of the following to go to the $HOME directory of current user:
  cd
  cd ~
  cd $HOME

- Go to the $HOME directory of a specific user:
  cd ~username
  
- Go to the root directory:
  cd /

- Go to the previous directory:
  cd -

- Go to the parent directory (one level up):
  cd ..

- Go up two directory levels:
  cd ../..
 
- Add aliases to your shell config for going up 2 or more levels.
  alias ..='cd ..'
  alias ...='cd ../..'
  alias .3='cd ../../..'
  alias .4='cd ../../../..'
  alias .5='cd ../../../../..'

title: 'cd' - change directory - Video Man Pages
